title: Weather and Seasons

vocab.definition: What the air outside is like - sunny, rainy, cloudy, or snowy
A time of year with certain kinds of weather
How hot or cold something is
Rain that falls from the sky

teachingNotes: Use weather chart daily. Discuss seasonal clothing and activities. Observe weather changes. Connect to calendar and months.

sample.question: What clothes would you wear on a snowy winter day?
What season has the hottest weather?
What falls from the sky when it rains?
When do leaves change colors and fall?

truefalse.question: We can have snow in summer.

You need an umbrella when it's sunny.

All places have the same weather at the same time.
Temperature tells us how hot or cold it is.
Winter is always the coldest season.

multiplechoice.question: What do you need when it's raining?

wordProblems.question: There are 4 seasons in a year. If we're in winter now, how many more seasons until winter comes again?
This week it rained 3 days and was sunny 4 days. How many days was that total?
Emily has 5 winter coats and 3 summer shirts. How many pieces of seasonal clothing does she have?
In spring, 6 flowers bloomed. In summer, 4 more flowers bloomed. How many flowers bloomed in total?
The temperature was 30 degrees in the morning and went up 20 degrees by afternoon. What was the afternoon temperature?
There are 12 months in a year. If each season has 3 months, how many seasons fit in a year?
Jake counted 8 rainy days and 5 snowy days this month. How many days had precipitation?
